Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a drab-coloured pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and contains many small inclusions, the exterior is covered with a pale-red slip and faint traces of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394500) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394500)
